description.narrative: The country programme has appropriate mechanisms in place for measuring progress on the situation of children and women with a specific emphasis on equity to inform planning, implementation and enhance learning by 2017., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is using appropriate mechanisms to measure, report and advocate progress on the situation of children and women with a specific emphasis on equity by 2017.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The country programme has appropriate mechanisms in place for measuring progress on the situation of children and women with a specific emphasis on equity to inform planning, implementation and enhance learning by 2017.

description.narrative: In 2017, the new CPD was finalized and approved by UNICEF's Executive Board. The CPMP supporting the CPD was also developed, with technical support from the Regional Office, and approved by the RO PBR committee. CPMP included a Resource Mobilization Strategy and Action Plan. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2018
